headline: Trump acknowledged JD Vance's past comments disparaging him but has 'put that aside'
author: Hannah Getahun
sentences: Vance, a Republican candidate for U.S. Senate in Ohio, shakes hands with former President Donald Trump during a rally hosted by the former president at the Delaware County Fairgrounds on April 23, 2022 in Delaware, Ohio.

"The president is right  I wasn't always nice," Vance said during the rally, "but the simple fact is he's the best president of my lifetime and he revealed the corruption in this country like nobody else."
"I go back and forth between thinking Trump is a cynical asshole like Nixon who wouldn't be that bad (and might even prove useful) or that he's America's Hitler" the text read.

Georgia Rep. Josh McLaurin, Vance's former college roommate, shared a screenshot Monday of a Facebook message exchange between him and Vance in 2016.
Trump recognized that JD Vance said some "bad shit" about him in the past while introducing the Ohio Senate candidate during a rally on Saturday.
Vance was a self-described "Never-Trump Guy" during the 2016 election, criticizing Trump as a racist who "actively antagonized Black voters."

During the rally, Trump said that voters had to "pick someone who could win" when mentioning Vance.
Representatives for Trump and Vance did not immediately return Insider's request for comment.
Trump endorsed Vance for Senate last Friday, to the chagrin of many Republican lawmakers.
He has since moved past the comments and referred to Vance as "someone who could win."
